intro: Bupleurum gerardi var. affiniforme, commonly known as the narrowleaf skullcap, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is found in mountainous regions. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers are small and white or pale yellow. It is valued in traditional medicine for its potential medicinal properties.
